title: Investor fervor for Bitcoin ETFs cools despite $646 million weekly surge in crypto funds
description:
Crypto-related investment products continued their upward trajectory, recording inflows of $646 million within the past week, according to CoinShares‘ weekly report. This inflow brings the total for the year to an unprecedented $13.8 billion, propelling the total assets under management to a staggering $94.47 billion. Bitcoin ETF hype moderating Trading volume for crypto investment products […]

The post Investor fervor for Bitcoin ETFs cools despite $646 million weekly surge in crypto funds appeared first on CryptoSlate.

title: Nigerian court orders Binance executive to remain in prison despite not guilty plea
description:
A Nigerian High Court in Abuja ordered that the detained Binance executive Tigran Gambaryan be remanded in prison following the postponement of his bail hearing. Gambaryan, a US citizen, pleaded not guilty to money laundering charges earlier today and will remain in custody until his bail hearing on April 18. The trial will commence on […]

The post Nigerian court orders Binance executive to remain in prison despite not guilty plea appeared first on CryptoSlate.

title: Sui expands collaboration with Space and Time to streamline data use for developers
description: Space and Time integrates Sui's RPC 2.0, offering developers a robust toolset for seamless and secure access to on-chain data.

title: dYdX community approves 60 million token stake with Stride
description: The dYdX community votes to stake $60 million in tokens with Stride, automating USDC rewards and bolstering network security.

title: Maximizing Profits In 2024: The Bitcoin Halving Investment Guide
description: Discover how to leverage the upcoming 2024 Bitcoin halving to your advantage and maximize profits. This comprehensive investment guide will provide you with an understanding of halving events and expert strategies to increase your returns in the cryptocurrency market.

title: Fed President Neel Kashkari Says Bitcoin Still Has ‘No Legitimate Use Case’
description:
The President of the Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis reportedly says that Bitcoin (BTC) has no legitimate use case and that it may be putting investors into “harm’s way.” Neel Kashkari, the bank’s President and CEO says that BTC is more of a consumer safety risk than a financial stability risk. In a LinkedIn Live […]

The post Fed President Neel Kashkari Says Bitcoin Still Has ‘No Legitimate Use Case’ appeared first on The Daily Hodl.
